the spits are a modern punk band whose
spit in the face of the assumption that
all modern punk rock is clean primped
and created pretty much just for radio
play they've been doing that for well
well well over 10 years now and have
several EPS and several LPS and and some
splits and singles to show for it
this self-titled LP is their latest and
while I didn't think it was their
strongest release it's definitely a fun
listen and furthers the grimy style that
they've been peddling on pretty much
every one of their releases now I
started off right with these guys years
ago by listening to their self-titled LP
first their self-titled debut LP first
they have a lot of self-titled releases
if I'm correct this is actually the
fifth thing that they've released that
is titled the Spitz but still for me
this first LP is the catchiest thing and
the most accessible thing that these
guys have released so far with tracks
like skate and die die die and black car
this album is just a really distorted
mid-paced punk rock album that is both
mind-numbing ly simple but also kind of
hilarious at the same time and this
album is no different though if there is
one noticeable change on here
the spits on this release continue
playing with the keyboards and and weird
sounds and noises and vocal effects and
drum machines that would pop up here and
there on previous releases
so as the spits kind of continued to
play with their old sound but also kind
of toy with these new electronics and
this continuously fuzzy and distorted
and grimy aesthetic this album has kind
of ended up being a mixture of older and
newer sounds for these guys there are
some really straightforward guitar and
vocal tracks on here that are kind of in
the spins usual style like the opener
all I want which is a very fun bouncy
love song it's got really silly lyrics
but it sticks in my head and I love love
the low toned deep distortion on that
track and the wailing guitar in the
background it's killer it's just got
this nice fuzzy grimy feel to it that I
can really sink my teeth into the way
these guys play the the guitar tones the
drumming and just the recording quality
just reminds me of like a combination of
the Ramones and wire but like a little
more low Phi and speaking of the Ramones
I know they've always had an influence
on the music these guys play but this is
the first time I would say I heard a
Spitz album where maybe I heard a little
bit more Ramones worship than I usually
do on tracks like brick by brick and my
life sucks the guitar tone the vocal
delivery the chords that the spits are
using just all of it just bleeds Ramones
the only thing that I think sets the
spitz apart is that they're a little
dirtier they're a little more atonal and
their songs are definitely shorter and
shorter keeping in line with other Spitz
releases every song on here is short as
hell in fact this whole release is short
as hell it's 12 tracks and they clock in
at just over 18 minutes so even if you
hate this thing it will not be taking up
too much room over your life so anyway
the tracks on here the sound like the
spits usual
stuff some of them are good some of them
are okay just nothing amazing nothing
new but the songs that really kind of
caught my ear on here were the ones like
tomorrow's children that track is like
an electronic piece of drum machine punk
that would have caught a pretty penny on
eBay if it had been released in 1979 and
was pressed on like a hundred seven
inches or something it's got these
whaling keyboards in the background and
just these these really throbbing
driving drum machines and these really
highly manipulated vocals that kind of
make the the vocalist sound like a robot
or an alien or something like that you
know from a sci-fi movie it sounds like
the spits but yeah it also kind of
reminds me of bands like blank dogs you
know just this bedroom rock project and
the last track on this album at that
single I mentioned did exist could have
easily been the b-side but outside of
those two tracks it's it's hard for me
to pick moments on this album that I
feel stick out in the spitz style it's
hard for me to pick moments on here that
really kind of stick out in this album
because so much of it just kind of feels
say me say me say me say me say me for
me if the songs were longer I guess it
would be a bigger problem but overall I
just kind of admire the feel of this
album it's filthy it's weird it's odd
it's drooling all over itself in some
kind of fierce rebellion against
cleanliness and and sanity when it comes
to punk music these guys are uniquely
lethargic noisy mean nasty and ugly I
really like the foundation that this
album lies on but I'm not exactly in
love with what the spits end up building
on it I guess what I feel like the spits
have built on this foundation with these
songs is kind of like a disgusting
roach-infested opium den it may be fun
to watch from afar with binoculars but
it's no place I'd want to visit without
a gun or a drug habit and I get it
that's probably intentional this album
is more about the sound for me and
that's cool the spits do make some
interesting sonic
choices on here like the blue P
keyboards on the track electric brain
and it sounds exactly like they're using
a chain-link fence as percussion on song
wanna be a DD the sounds are cool but I
feel like the songs could have been
written to be catchy er or more
memorable really the spits don't really
display themselves as good songwriters
here and I felt like that that did come
into play on their earlier releases
because as I dug underneath the the
grime of each song I found that some of
the tunes on here we're good and others
were just kind of forgettable and
overall I'm just not really finding
anything on this LP that is all that new
for the band in comparison with their
last album there's a lot of
instrumentation that is shared with this
LP though the recording on here is
noticeably better I don't think these
guys are necessarily breaking any new
new ground on this LP but still they're
consistent and if this is your first
introduction to the Spitz it may not be
a bad place to start I thought this
thing was a likable listen feeling a
light to decent six on this but if
